intro: Tabebuia jojoana, commonly known as the yellow trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in the spring. The tree has a straight trunk and broad, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the branches. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
